abstract: In the aftermath of the genocide against the Tutsis in Rwanda in 1994, the country was left with a collapsed health system and a huge burden of mental health problems to deal with. With only one psychiatrist at the time, a health ecosystem had to be reinvented to deal with these fragilities. The training of mental health nurses since 1998 has forged the professionals who have contributed significantly to the rebuilding of the mental health system in Rwanda.
